Line1: Eden Prime. This is where it all began.
Line2: Where the Prothean beacon gave you the vision that warned us about the Reapers.
Line3: Yes. And now with Cerberus here, Eden Prime's colonists are under attack again.
column8: Cerberus hit Eden Prime hard. Whatever they found here was worth a major offensive.

Line1: (Medium gasp 1)
Line2: (Medium gasp 2)
Line3: (Medium gasp 3)
column8: (Medium gasp 4)

Line1: Come on. Let's keep moving.
Line2: Something's not right.
Line3: Look out!

Line1: You can't sleep?
Line2: Already?
Line3: You don't need to worry about that.
column8: You rallied who you could. The Reapers won't get any more chances to divide us.

Line1: Looks clear. Let's go!
Line2: Up here, Shepard.
Line3: Come on, let's keep moving.

Line1: Thank you again, Commander. I appreciate the assist.
Line2: Commander Shepard? Thank you. I'm sure that will help with... ah, any operation we have going.
Line3: Ma'am, I had a friend in security at Sonax, and there was definitely Prothean tech on Garvug.
column8: I know the Valhallan Threshold is Reaper territory now, but Prothean tech could help the Cruci--

Line1: The infection has located our network packets.
Line2: Yes. Avoid contact.
Line3: Destroying higher processes, closing our exit.
column8: You must hurry.

Line1: Power offline.
Line2: Power now online.
Line3: Hurry up!
column8: Let's move.

Line1: Watch your line of fire!
Line2: Target the geth!
Line3: Adjust your aim!
column8: Hold your fire!

Line1: I heard about the horrible things Cerberus did during the coup. That's not the organization I joined.
Line2: I'm still thinking about your last visit. I just wish... Promise me you'll be careful.
Line3: I miss being with you.
column8: These refugees have no place to go.

Line1: There's only one way this ends.
Line2: Target the supports.
Line3: Cerberus thanks you for all your hard work.
column8: Target the beacon.

Line1: If you're hearing this... then there is still hope.
Line2: Hope that you can avoid the same mistakes we made.
Line3: We fought the Reapers, but we failed to stop them.
column8: We did everything we could. We built the Crucible, but it didn't work. We fought as a united galaxy, but it wasn't enough.

Line1: Attention. The station is at Code Red.
Line2: Security doors have been sealed for your protection.
Line3: Please exit the building in an orderly fashion.
column8: Unlawful discharge of firearms is a misdemeanor punishable by up to ten Citadel standard months in jail.

Line1: Straight ahead and around the corner--past the first barricade.
Line2: If you're looking for command, it's around the corner, past the first barricade.

Line1: Sir, shuttle carrying the fighter mechanics has not arrived. Presumed MIA.
Line2: Twenty-nine, sir.
Line3: Yes, sir.

Line1: Look--reinforcements are here!
Commander, Admiral Hackett is available on vid comm.
Line2: Commander, Admiral Anderson is available on vid comm.
Line3: Shepard, over here.
column8: Shepard.

Line1: Really? And they're already riding the first units into battle? Well, that's... that's... great!
Line2: No, no, don't worry about that. It's how kakliosaurs mark territory, and the krogan don't seem to mind.
Line3: You're kidding. Seriously? Well, um... if the genetic material is intact, we could... hmm. We've got cloning facilities on Sur'Kesh.
column8: Kakliosaur genes were remarkably pliable. Cloning might be effective!

Line1: Shepard, we've got Reaper signatures in orbit.
Line2: Shepard.
Line3: Hello.
column8: Everyone's on-edge. Who can blame them?

Line1: Here, Commander.
Line2: Things get worse by the minute. My men are dying!
Line3: Commander, come in!
column8: Do you read, Commander? Repeat: Do you read?

Line1: Shepard! It's really you! I could just hug you.
Line2: I've been so worried.
Line3: Without my Cerberus contacts, I had no way of knowing if you'd survived the invasion.
column8: Working with you opened my eyes, got me thinking. I looked closely at what Cerberus had done.

Line1: Here, Commander.
Line2: Things get worse by the minute. My men are dying!
Line3: Commander, come in!
column8: Do you read, Commander? Repeat: Do you read?

Line1: And there's the folks who answered the distress call. Cerberus cruiser. At least a dozen fighters on blockade duty.
Line2: Too many for us in a straight-up fight. They must want this place bad.
Line3: Boy, can I!
column8: Come and get me!

Line1: Oh, my god. Would ya look at that...
Line2: Took out a frigate--man, how many people?
Line3: Holy crap.
column8: Those fighters aren't even making a dent.

Line1: Figures. Finally back in action, and the Alliance already wants us tagged and collared.
Line2: Yes ma'am! Requesting docking permission.

Line1: Fly ahead of the curve with Curve Glider Sporting Goods. Our experts assemble products for all your extreme sporting needs.
Line2: Skate it, bike it, run, or soar. There are no limits to what you can do.
Line3: Warning: Curve gliding is an illegal act on the Citadel. Curve Glider Sporting Goods takes no responsibility for arrest or injury.

Line1: She's faster than she looks.
Line2: She's getting away!
Line3: For increased tactical control, bring up the Power Wheel.
column8: This pauses the action, giving you time to evaluate the battlefield, target new enemies, and select a power.

Line1: Help! We can't hold them much longer!
Line2: Please! Help us!
Line3: Oh, no! No!
column8: Aaagh!

Line1: The galaxy's more dangerous than ever, and you need the best. That's where Snap, Crackle, and Shock comes in.
Line2: We offer electric fencing, vehicle security, and electroshock weapons for all your defense needs.
Line3: Stop humans, geth, even husks dead in their tracks with 250,000 volts. All without the danger of a firearm.
column8: Snap, Crackle, and Shock! Because real defense solutions are about keeping your loved ones safe.

Line1: That doctor in the vid was in a restricted zone.
Line2: She's with the Alliance, I think, but I don't know much about her. She keeps to herself.
Line3: We only met once. I got the distinct impression she didn't want to be friends.
column8: Maybe. She couldn't have done it alone.

Line1: Joker! Are you a sight for sore eyes!
Line2: Joker! Good timing.

Line1: Hey, Shepard. if you came to spring me, you're late. I'm getting out soon.
Line2: Maybe you already saw the vid, but I accepted Udina's offer.
Line3: Only the second human Spectre. It's humbling.
column8: Udina thinks they might have a pretty big ceremony, even with the war.

Line1: Toxicity levels lethal, Commander! Find alternate route immediately!
Line2: Radiation proximity warning, Commander. Avoid at all costs.
Line3: You're clear for the moment, Commander. Can't raise Captain Riley.
column8: Nothing, Commander. No one's answering my hails.

Line1: This victory belongs to each of us.
Line2: Every man, woman, and child.
Line3: Every civilization... on every world.
column8: And though our victory was costly, it is still a victory.

Line1: Thank you, human. We will hold the pillars close to our hearts... and persevere.
Line2: Thank you. Right now, my people need any reminder of their faith they can get.
Line3: Maintain, my brothers and sisters--we have faced adversity, and overcome. This is but a test!
column8: Remember the pillars of strength that hold our people high. Show the galaxy our resolve!

Line1: Shepard... my crew. Perhaps there's still time.
Line2: Hello? This is Zaal'Koris. Does anyone copy? Hello!
Line3: I pray they found comfort in the homeworld's skies.

Line1: Don't let them grab you.
Line2: Good work. Let's keep moving.
Line3: I'm outta ammo!
column8: Take 'em out any way you can.

Line1: Any improvement?
Line2: Huh. Probably experimental. It's a long shot, but let's run some tests and see if it might work for our patient.
Line3: There's got to be something... I don't know what Cerberus was packing, but we're going to lose this patient.

Line1: The tubes don't go on forever... but where the hell are we?
Line2: Whoa...
Line3: One of the walls here just realigned itself. The place is shifting. Changing.
column8: There's a chasm here... and more hallways like the one I was in.

Line1: Try them again.
Line2: Try them again.
Line3: That's an order.

Line1: Whoa!
Line2: Please don't kill me. I surrender! Just don't kill me.

Line1: Destination?
Line2: Roger that.

Line1: Commander.
Line2: Good day, Commander.
Line3: Commander Shepard--Dr. Gavin Archer. We... met on Project Overlord.
column8: Yes, well, after you took my brother to Grissom Academy, I tried putting all that behind me.

Line1: I'll honor her by kicking ass, Commander.
Line2: Commander, I... I'm the only one who made it. The captain... sacrificed herself to save me.
Line3: Always, Commander.
column8: Three tours. Been through thick and thicker. The captain always sees us through.

Line1: My god. He did it.
Line2: My god. She did it.
Line3: Holy shit. He did it.
column8: Holy shit. She did it.

Line1: (Medium gasp 1)
Line2: (Medium gasp 2)
Line3: (Medium gasp 3)
column8: (Medium gasp 4)

Line1: Thanks again. If we can get it working, this jamming tech will make this place a lot safer.
Line2: How the hell did you--never mind. Tech like this, I don't care where it came from.
Line3: I'll have my people run with this. When the war comes back here, maybe we can save more lives.
column8: Autorecord on. Scene contains large scorch marks. Looks like three fatalities. The entire area's shot to hell.

Line1: Atmosphere's a little thinner than I'm used to, is all.
Line2: Adrenaline's better than oxygen any day.

Line1: I'll honor her by kicking ass, Commander.
Line2: Commander, I... I'm the only one who made it. The captain... sacrificed herself to save me.
Line3: Always, Commander.
column8: Three tours. Been through thick and thicker. The captain always sees us through.

Line1: No, it's fine. We won't be needing your supplies after all.
Line2: No, we've found a better variant of medi-gel that allows for an even higher absorption rate among aquatic species.
Line3: You'd like a sample? Why, of course, we'll be happy to send you one--just as we sent one to every pharmaceutical company in Citadel space.
column8: Where did you find this? Never mind, it doesn't matter. Yes, we can put this to good use. Thank you!

Line1: Ma'am, I'm picking up chatter from a Cerberus squad engaging the supply depot.
Line2: And if I'm reading it right, sounds like more troops are on the way.
Line3: Shepard, I'm picking up chatter from a Cerberus squad engaging the supply depot.
column8: Sir, I'm picking up chatter from a Cerberus squad engaging the supply depot.

Line1: Circuit interruption. Remaining offline.
Line2: Failure at junction. Repair and reset.
Line3: Power restored. Gun one reset. Circuit incomplete.
column8: Power restored. Circuit reset. Guns operational.

Line1: Species 408--the varren--could provide a novel form of biological warfare.
Line2: With enhanced size and intelligence, they could harass hostile civilian populations at minimal cost.
Line3: Recommend project approval.

Line1: Low power. Please wait.
Line2: When the moment is right, you know what you want.
Line3: You want a gentle touch. A revealing look. And clothing to match.
column8: This One's Intimate Apparel. For all species who put on clothing... or take it off.

Line1: This victory belongs to each of us.
Line2: Every man, woman, and child.
Line3: Every civilization... on every world.
column8: And though our victory was costly, it is still a victory.

Line1: Watch your line of fire!
Line2: Target the geth!
Line3: Adjust your aim!
column8: Hold your fire!

Line1: Yes, Commander Shepard found some encryption algorithms. The team is expecting results soon now.
Line2: Cerberus ciphers? That's exactly what we've been looking for. Thank you, Commander!
Line3: This is a problem, boss. Cerberus has changed their ciphers, and our code-breakers aren't getting anywhere at the moment.
column8: I've got our best teams working in shifts on it, but ensuring Citadel systems integrity is just going to take time.

Line1: Yes, Commander Shepard found some encryption algorithms. The team is expecting results soon now.
Line2: Cerberus ciphers? That's exactly what we've been looking for. Thank you, Commander!
Line3: This is a problem, boss. Cerberus has changed their ciphers, and our code-breakers aren't getting anywhere at the moment.
column8: I've got our best teams working in shifts on it, but ensuring Citadel systems integrity is just going to take time.

Line1: Did that all really happen?
Line2: When can I go to the stars?
Line3: What will be there?
column8: Can you tell me another story about the Shepard?

Line1: Enemy on the roof!
Line2: On our six! You! Come with me!
Line3: Reinforcements arriving, sir!
column8: Echo, Tango, and Delta squads are on the ground!

Line1: This victory belongs to each of us.
Line2: Every man, woman, and child.
Line3: Every civilization... on every world.
column8: And though our victory was costly, it is still a victory.

Line1: I'm almost done with the system upgrade. Yeah, I know--it's going to be amazing!
Line2: Hey... could we maybe give a portion of our profits to a krogan charity? I mean, it's old, but we are using their tech, right?
Line3: Whoa. Those really are old but... solid! We could totally convert our current systems to this! Thanks!
column8: I know people are complaining. We're doing what we can with what we've got here, but--

Line1: Commander, you saved our asses. My team is in your debt.
Line2: We'll be ready.
Line3: Something's off. Reapers are here for a reason, but we've only seen a handful--doesn't compute.
column8: Commander, in your sights.

Line1: So what were you able to pull from the inscriptions? Really? Excellent! I knew they'd find something.
Line2: Commander Shepard? That's excellent news. I'll have it sent to that project right away.
Line3: Thank you so much for your help.
column8: Listen, I thought of something. No, it can't wait until I'm back on duty.

Line1: Our ships are in position, Shepard!
Watch out!
Line2: Careful!
Line3: Wrong target!
column8: We're not geth!

Line1: Acknowledged. I'll send the word.
Line2: All ships, this is Admiral Hackett. The Crucible is on the move. I repeat: the Crucible is on the move.
Line3: Protect it at all costs. Everyone... this is it.
column8: Any available squadrons: delay those Reapers leaving the battle.

Line1: Evacuation Level Alpha--proceed directly to muster points for shuttle assignments.
Line2: Nonessential equipment and effects may be brought to shuttle bay for triage.
Line3: Evacuation in progress. Remain calm. Evacuation in progress. Remain calm.
column8: Personnel from Project Mia should now be on board and ready to depart.

Line1: Fielding an avalanche of civilian SOS requests, Commander. The bulk are concentrated on the upper street.
Line2: Cerberus forces are pinning them down. You'd better hurry.
Line3: Roger that.

Line1: Aaah!
Line2: Go go go! Move!
Line3: Yeah! One down!
column8: Help us!

Line1: Got more back here!
Any improvement?
Line2: Huh. Probably experimental. It's a long shot, but let's run some tests and see if it might work for our patient.
Line3: There's got to be something... I don't know what Cerberus was packing, but we're going to lose this patient.

Line1: Shuttle one away--two shuttles remaining.
Line2: Shuttle two away--one shuttle remaining.
Line3: Shuttle three away--evacuation complete.

Line1: I am alive.
Line2: All of us, synthetic and organic, have been changed.
Line3: The war is over, and the Reapers are helping to rebuild. Where once they threatened us with extinction...
column8: ...they now bring us the collective knowledge of the cultures that came before.

Line1: I am alive.
Line2: All of us, synthetic and organic, have been changed.
Line3: The war is over, and the Reapers are helping to rebuild. Where once they threatened us with extinction...
column8: ...they now bring us the collective knowledge of the cultures that came before.

Line1: Did that all really happen?
Line2: When can I go to the stars?
Line3: What will be there?
column8: Can you tell me another story about the Shepard?

Line1: Toxicity levels lethal, Commander! Find alternate route immediately!
Line2: Radiation proximity warning, Commander. Avoid at all costs.
Line3: You're clear for the moment, Commander. Can't raise Captain Riley.
column8: Nothing, Commander. No one's answering my hails.

Line1: My people have been in exile for centuries. To be standing here in the land of my ancestors...
Line2: Keelah! I'm standing on Rannoch. I'm on my homeworld.

Line1: Yes, General Korilius should make a full recovery. He's already awake and responsive.
Line2: Let me see... Yes, I think this is it! With these schematics, we should be able to come up with an antidote!
Line3: Thank you. The general might pull through because of this.
column8: I understand Palaven is very busy, but this is one of your own generals.

Line1: If we die, we die together.
Line2: What... what should we do?
Line3: I'm so scared.
column8: I don't want to die.

Line1: All ships, finish them off!
The clutch has stabilized? Really? That is wonderful news, my sister.
Line2: You wish to name the first hatched after the one who helped us? I think that's a wonderful idea.
Line3: This... is amazing! The colonists--my sister--will be most pleased! Thank you. I am in your debt.
column8: This is problematic. We must find a way to stabilize the heating units so the water temperature can remain steady.

Line1: Warning: All evacuation stations are currently nonfunctional.
Access code required.
Enemy on the roof!
Line2: On our six! You! Come with me!
Line3: Reinforcements arriving, sir!
column8: Echo, Tango, and Delta squads are on the ground!

Line1: Welcome to Citadel Security. Please move forward to the waiting area, where you will be assigned a number.
Line2: To pay a fine, please see our extranet site. To report an unsafe airlock, dial 511.
Line3: Your estimated wait time is: zero minutes.
column8: Look at that.

Line1: Nice shot, Tex.
Line2: Hell of a wake-up call.
Line3: Not a problem for someone with biotics.
column8: Give me the word. I'll draw them out.

Line1: I heard about the horrible things Cerberus did during the coup. That's not the organization I joined.
Line2: I'm still thinking about your last visit. I just wish... Promise me you'll be careful.
Line3: I miss being with you.
column8: These refugees have no place to go.

Line1: Shepard! You saved my life again.
Line2: Cerberus troopers came through here to secure the docks. They lined us all up.
Line3: Then one of them starting asking around for me by name.
column8: Their records said I went off-grid. If I hadn't changed my identity, I don't know what would have happened. Thank you.

Line1: I've got a fix on the Council's position. I'm sending it to your car.
Line2: Another security lock. I can bypass it.

Line1: You're slower than I imagined, Shepard.
Line2: Your friend Thane died like a coward.
Line3: You'll be joining him soon.
column8: Your friend Kirrahe died like a coward.

Line1: Security override in effect.
Line2: Hold your fire! Friendly inbound!
Line3: Thank you!
column8: Thanks for the help.

Line1: Did that all really happen?
Line2: When can I go to the stars?
Line3: What will be there?
column8: Can you tell me another story about the Shepard?

Line1: Take them out! I'll get you in!
Line2: Watch out, they've sealed the entrance!

Line1: Thanks again. If we can get it working, this jamming tech will make this place a lot safer.
Line2: How the hell did you--never mind. Tech like this, I don't care where it came from.
Line3: I'll have my people run with this. When the war comes back here, maybe we can save more lives.
column8: Autorecord on. Scene contains large scorch marks. Looks like three fatalities. The entire area's shot to hell.

Line1: Hah! The banner of the First Regiment! That should put some steel in their spine!
Line2: The banner of-- Commander Shepard, I owe you a drink. Thank you.
Line3: We'll hold that banner proudly as we take our homeworld back from these bastards.
column8: Damn it, morale is pitiful. The troops need something to bring back their fighting spirit.

Line1: I'll honor her by kicking ass, Commander.
Line2: Commander, I... I'm the only one who made it. The captain... sacrificed herself to save me.
Line3: Always, Commander.
column8: Three tours. Been through thick and thicker. The captain always sees us through.

Line1: There should be a control access point for the ventilation system.
Line2: Ventilation system is shut down. Might be enough auxiliary power to activate fans on the main floor.
Line3: Radiation cutting access to most of the grid. Need to ventilate.
column8: Confirming. Toxic radiation cutting access to most of the grid. Survival in hot spots not possible.

Line1: Diomedes team, we have hostiles at the perimeter!
Species 408--the varren--could provide a novel form of biological warfare.
Line2: With enhanced size and intelligence, they could harass hostile civilian populations at minimal cost.
Line3: Recommend project approval.

Line1: The clutch has stabilized? Really? That is wonderful news, my sister.
Line2: You wish to name the first hatched after the one who helped us? I think that's a wonderful idea.
Line3: This... is amazing! The colonists--my sister--will be most pleased! Thank you. I am in your debt.
column8: This is problematic. We must find a way to stabilize the heating units so the water temperature can remain steady.

Line1: Toxicity levels lethal, Commander! Find alternate route immediately!
Line2: Radiation proximity warning, Commander. Avoid at all costs.
Line3: You're clear for the moment, Commander. Can't raise Captain Riley.
column8: Nothing, Commander. No one's answering my hails.

Line1: Son of a bitch.
Line2: This is the admiral. Our readings suggest that someone made it to the beam.
Line3: We need to give them time to get the Citadel arms open.
column8: All fleets: Converge on the Crucible. Protect it at all costs.

Line1: Proximity alert. Deploying armed response.
Line2: Defense system deactivated. General order seven slash seven triggered--establish contingency defenses.
Line3: Defense system deactivation prioritized. Awaiting shutdown command.
column8: Warning, warning. Security breach. Initiating lockdown failsafe.

Line1: Get the techs from Stockholm cell to pack their own crates. I need you up here.
Yes.
Line2: It was highly significant. You were the first organic to openly cooperate with geth since the end of the Morning War.
Line3: We wish to ensure you are not the last.
column8: The prospect remains. If the Reaper presence is removed, there is a chance of reunification with geth--and perhaps creators.

Line1: The reinforcements haven't arrived.
Line2: We could really use air support general.
Line3: Waiting for your orders, sir.

Line1: Reset complete. Access enabled.
Getting paid to fly circles around Cerberus? Yeah, I could do this for a living.
This is it, everyone. The arms are opening.
Line2: Ten seconds to contact.
Line3: That's it! The Crucible is docked!
column8: Shepard. Commander!

Line1: Okay, boys! Now's our chance!
Line2: Give it everything you've got.
Line3: Let's bring the goddamn bastards to their knees!
column8: Ajax squad! Right flank!

Line1: Keep your head down.
Line2: Take those guys out below.
Line3: Nice shot.
column8: Finish them off!

Line1: Denied. All ships, full barrage!
Line2: Yes, I'm seeing increased turnout as well. We may actually make it through this war.
Line3: That's... wonderful! Thank you!
column8: My people will treat this miraculous find as a call to support their local hospitals.

Line1: Yes, General Korilius should make a full recovery. He's already awake and responsive.
Line2: Let me see... Yes, I think this is it! With these schematics, we should be able to come up with an antidote!
Line3: Thank you. The general might pull through because of this.
column8: I understand Palaven is very busy, but this is one of your own generals.

Line1: We've got hostiles on the perimeter!
Line2: Get on that gun!

Line1: Not if I can help it!
Line2: No she isn't!
Line3: The hell she is!
column8: I got this one!

Line1: Security doors have been sealed for your protection.
Line2: With sincere gratitude, thank you, human.
Line3: With shock and joy, really. This is wonderful news.
column8: Thank you, human. Sincerely, this will greatly aid our people.

Line1: I've been looking forward to a rematch.
Line2: This is better than Thessia. More personal.
Line3: All you're doing is making humanity weaker!
column8: And I'm stronger for it!

Line1: I can handle myself, Wrex.
Line2: I'm not your property, Wreav.

Line1: No, it's fine. We won't be needing your supplies after all.
Line2: No, we've found a better variant of medi-gel that allows for an even higher absorption rate among aquatic species.
Line3: You'd like a sample? Why, of course, we'll be happy to send you one--just as we sent one to every pharmaceutical company in Citadel space.
column8: Where did you find this? Never mind, it doesn't matter. Yes, we can put this to good use. Thank you!

Line1: If you're hearing this... then there is still hope.
Line2: Hope that you can avoid the same mistakes we made.
Line3: We fought the Reapers, but we failed to stop them.
column8: We did everything we could. We built the Crucible, but it didn't work. We fought as a united galaxy, but it wasn't enough.

Line1: Root access acquired. Severing all connections to this communication node.
Line2: Establishing connection to remaining communication node.
Line3: Proceed to the access point.
column8: Shepard-Commander: Please proceed to the access point.

Line1: I'm almost done with the system upgrade. Yeah, I know--it's going to be amazing!
Line2: Hey... could we maybe give a portion of our profits to a krogan charity? I mean, it's old, but we are using their tech, right?
Line3: Whoa. Those really are old but... solid! We could totally convert our current systems to this! Thanks!
column8: I know people are complaining. We're doing what we can with what we've got here, but--

Line1: What the hell's going on? Where's Anderson? Where we going?
Line2: Hey!
Line3: Leaving?
column8: Bullshit. He wouldn't order us to leave.

Line1: Thank you, Earth-Clan. My people are still afraid, but they are remembering who they are.
Line2: Earth-Clan, this is a priceless gift. Thank you.
Line3: You may help my people remember themselves.
column8: Overcharging for goods, denying refugees basic services... It seems the Reapers took our culture when they took our world.

Line1: Cutting it a little close!
Line2: Cutting it a little close, don't you think?
Line3: Watch out!
column8: Careful!

Line1: Thank you!
Line2: Thanks for the help.
Line3: All personnel: Hull integrity may be compromised.
column8: Proceed to protective bunkers or secure vacuum-rated equipment.

Line1: Thank you.
Line2: Oh, Jaime. I didn't want to come here with these people. It was his idea.
Line3: What am I going to do without him?
column8: Our work? Are you crazy? We're all going to die here!

Line1: This victory belongs to each of us.
Line2: Every man, woman, and child.
Line3: Every civilization... on every world.
column8: And though our victory was costly, it is still a victory.

Line1: Keep your head down.
Line2: Take those guys out below.
Line3: Nice shot.
column8: Finish them off!

Line1: Shepard-Commander, find cover!
Did that all really happen?
Line2: And that's why we have peace?
Line3: What else do we know about the Shepard?
column8: Can you tell me another one? Please?

Line1: This is it, everyone. The arms are opening.
Line2: Ten seconds to contact.
Line3: That's it! The Crucible is docked!
column8: Shepard. Commander!

Line1: I can handle myself, Wrex.
Line2: I'm not your property, Wreav.

Line1: (Medium gasp 1)
Line2: (Medium gasp 2)
Line3: (Medium gasp 3)
column8: (Medium gasp 4)

Line1: Mapping to consensus. Remain still.
Line2: Shepard-Commander, excess movement during an upload is discouraged.
Line3: Door disabled. Breaker reset required.

Line1: Watch out!
Line2: Careful!
Line3: Wrong target!
column8: We're not geth!

Line1: That Reaper is enormous.
Line2: Goddess.

Line1: It's quiet up here.
Line2: Weird that it's so peaceful here with what's going on.
Line3: Anxious to get back at it.
column8: Great view.

Line1: Commander! We can't let the barricade fall!
Line2: If we don't take care of this, the camp will get overrun.
Line3: This way! We've still got hostiles back here.
column8: We told Corinthus we'd help defend the barricade.

Line1: For increased tactical control, bring up the Power Menu.
Line2: This pauses the action, giving you time to evaluate the battlefield, target new enemies, and select a power.
Line3: To use a power to attack an opponent, target the enemy before pausing the game, then highlight and select the power.
column8: The power will fire at the targeted enemy as you return to action.

Line1: Aaah!
Line2: Go go go! Move!
Line3: Yeah! One down!
column8: Help us!

Line1: Not a problem for someone with biotics.
Line2: Give me the word. I'll draw them out.
Line3: I can use singularity to draw them out!
column8: Coward. Show your head!

Line1: Reset complete. Access enabled.
Good to meet you! I'm Commander Shepard, Alliance Navy.
Line2: Extranet says you're Alliance Military. Take care of yourself out there, officer.
Line3: There's nothing this galaxy can't beat if we all work together.
column8: Except the Reapers. Ever see the size of one of those things?

Line1: I will bypass the lock. If you are interested, the console nearby is still functional.
Here they come!
Here, Commander.
Line2: Things get worse by the minute. My men are dying!
Line3: Commander, come in!
column8: Do you read, Commander? Repeat: Do you read?
